CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C03

TI_TEXT.P: Υπηρεσίες παροχής συμβουλών σε θέματα ασφάλειας
Services de conseil en matière de sécurité
Servizi di consulenza in materia di sicurezza
Serviços de consultoria em matéria de segurança
Servicii de consultanţă în domeniul securităţii

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.CONTACT_POINT: Vergabestelle, for the attention of: Mr. Benjamin Eisenbraun

TITLE.P: Risk Management System and related Security Services

SHORT_DESCR.P: KfW (short for “Kreditanstalt für Wiederaufbau”) had offered the following business opportunity which was tendered in two separate lots:

Lot 1: service contract aiming at supporting KfW's risk and security management to ensure the security of KfW personnel and of consultants working on behalf of KfW in the Great Lakes region (Africa), especially in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The assignment included information services, mission facilitation and emergency support. It required the permanent presence of a security expert on-site.

Lot 2: framework agreement aiming at supporting KfW's risk and security management to ensure the security of KfW personnel and of consultants working on behalf of KfW on projects and missions in the region of the Horn of Africa, especially in Somaliland. The assignment included information services, mission facilitation on-site and emergency support. The contractor had to coordinate, support and accompany KfW's staff and consultants on their missions.

TITLE.P: Security Services in the Great Lakes Region, especially Democratic Republic of Congo

MAIN_SITE.P: While the contract is governed by German law and the place of arbitration shall be Frankfurt am Main (Germany), the services will be performed in the Great Lakes Region, especially Republic of Congo.

SHORT_DESCR.P: KfW operates offices in the Democratic Republic of Congo (mainly Kinshasa), in Uganda (Kampala), in Rwanda(Kigali) and in Burundi (Bujumbara).

The aim of this assignment was to reinforce a risk management system within KfW in order to ensure the security of KfW personnel and of various consultants working on behalf of KfW in this geographic region.

KfW required on-site security services on an uninterrupted basis 365 days per year. The contractor needed to engage 2 to 3 experienced experts in safety and security management who will take turns to travel between theaforementioned countries, providing the following Services:
1— Information Services, among else:
— acquisition of security information and assessment of the day-to-day security situation,
— networking with security focal Points (mainly GIZ and the German embassy),
— regular updating/revision of the security plan for KfW offices,
— risk management advice and support for KfW headquarters and offices,
— security training for national personnel,
— security monitoring reports,
— site security assessments (office, hotels etc.).
2— Mission Facilitation (on-site), among else:
— coordination of and support for logistics and transportation for incoming missions,
— security briefing for incoming missions.
3— Support in cases of emergency, among else:
— coordinating and managing of security or health related incidents, e.g. transfer of affected persons to medical assistance or evacuation,
— provision or coordination of First Aid,
— active support in emergency/crisis situations in close coordination with KfW staff,
— if needed, coordination of close protection services.

The contractor furthermore needed to appoint 1 backstopper. This person will work off-site and provide technical and organizational support to the experts working on-site besides acting as contact person for KfW.

AC_QUALITY.AC_CRITERION: Tenderer’s written elaboration to the pre-defined problem
Presentation of the suggested problem solution in English during the negotiation meeting
Tenderer’s approach to a case study set before him in the negotiation meeting
Presentation of the suggested approach in French during the negotiation meeting

TITLE.P: Security Services at the Horn of Africa, especially Somaliland

MAIN_SITE.P: While the contract is governed by German law and the place of arbitration shall be Frankfurt am Main(Germany), the services will be performed at the Horn of Africa, especially Somaliland.

SHORT_DESCR.P: At the horn of Africa, KfW operates offices in Kenya (Nairobi) and in Ethiopia (Addis Abeba). The office in Nairobi further supports projects implemented in Djibouti, Eritrea, Somalia, Sudan and South Sudan.

The aim of this assignment was to reinforce a risk management system within KfW in order to ensure the security of KfW personnel and of consultants working on behalf of KfW at the Horn of Africa (Ethiopia, Somalia,South Sudan, Sudan), with an emphasis on Somaliland.

The contractor had to engage experienced experts in safety and security management who will accompany missions of KfW to the Horn of Africa, providing the services specified below. For each mission, KfW required the following on-site security services of one expert with international professional Background:
1— Information services, among else:
— security assessment on demand before mission,
— provision of ad-hoc reports, including recommendations for staff security,
— provision of a HRE-Plan (hibernation, re-localization and evacuation),
— site security assessments (especially hotels and guesthouses).
2— Mission facilitation (on-site), among else:

— coordination and provision of logistics and transportation for the incoming missions including (if requested) provision of armored vehicles (according to KfW standards) and special protection units (according togovernment requirements),
— security briefing for incoming missions,
— provision of necessary telecommunication equipment (VHF / Satphones),
— provision of any other security related equipment (bullet proofed vests, helmets, first-aid/trauma kits),
— accompanying missions.
3— Support in cases of emergency, among else:
— coordinating and managing any security or health related incident, e.g. the transfer of affected persons to medical assistance or their evacuation,
— provision or coordination of First Aid,
— active support in emergency /crisis situations in close coordination with KfW staff,
— if needed, coordination of close protection services.

The contractor furthermore had to appoint one backstopper. This person will work off-site and provide technical and organizational support to the experts working on-site besides acting as contact person for KfW.

AC_QUALITY.AC_CRITERION: Tenderer’s written elaboration to a pre-defined problem
Presentation of the suggested problem solution during the negotiation meeting
Tenderer’s approach to a case study set before him in the negotiation meeting
Presentation of the suggested approach in English during the negotiation meeting
